result.execSummary:
The defendant James Gordon Gill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Non-Narcotics, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

miscConds.notes: Work out payment plan with agent.
Work out payment plan with agent.
Obtain or maintain full time employment.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms.
Provide DNA sample & pay surcharge.

Maintain absolute sobriety to include no purchase, possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription and taken only as prescribed and as approved by agent.  
Defendant is not to be in the company of any person who is using, purchasing or possessing illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  
Defendant is not to possess or consume any prescription medications without a valid prescription.  All prescriptions shall be verified by agent.
No contact with CI 166 - J.B.

Enter into, participate in and successfully complete any assessments, evaluations and/or treatment programs as directed by the agent.
AODA assessment and follow through.

timeConds.notes: Huber release if in compliance with the jail rules and regulations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
